1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Construction of relmaps.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Construct
6  ( -- * Source
7    relmapConst, relmapSource,
8
9    -- * Calculation
10    relmapFlow, relmapHook,
11    relmapBinary, relmapConfl,
12
13    -- * Variable
14    relmapLink,
15    relmapNest, relmapLocalNest,
16    relmapCopy, relmapLocalSymbol, 
17
18    -- * Append relmaps
19    -- $AppendRelmaps
20
21    -- * Bundle of constructors
22    ConsRelmap', consRelmap,
23  ) where
24
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                  as B
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                as S
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Type                  as T
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap           as C
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relkit           as C
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Relmap    as C
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Rop       as C
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Message          as Msg
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Message   as Msg
35
36
37-- ----------------------  Source
38
39-- | Make a constant relmap.
40relmapConst :: C.Intmed' h c -> T.Rel c -> C.Relmap' h c
41relmapConst = C.RelmapConst . C.medLexmap
42
43-- | Relmap for retrieving relation from dataset.
44relmapSource :: C.Intmed' h c -> S.JudgeClass -> [S.TermName] -> C.Relmap' h c
45relmapSource = C.RelmapSource . C.medLexmap
46
47
48-- ----------------------  Calculation
49
50-- | Make a flow relmap.
51--   Flow relmaps take no submaps.
52relmapFlow :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.RelkitFlow c -> C.Relmap' h c
53relmapFlow use relkit = relmapConfl use (const relkit) []
54
55-- | Relmap with hook data.
56relmapHook :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.RelkitHook' h c -> C.Relmap' h c
57relmapHook = C.RelmapHook . C.medLexmap
58
59-- | Make a binary relmap.
60--   Binary relmaps take one submap.
61relmapBinary :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.RelkitBinary c -> C.Relmap' h c -> C.Relmap' h c
62relmapBinary use kit rmap = relmapConfl use (kit . head) [rmap]
63
64-- | Make a confluent relmap.
65--   Confluent relmaps take multiple submaps.
66relmapConfl :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.RelkitConfl c -> [C.Relmap' h c] -> C.Relmap' h c
67relmapConfl = C.RelmapCalc . C.medLexmap
68
69
70-- ----------------------  Variable
71
72-- | Link-to-other relmap.
73relmapLink :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.Relmap' h c
74relmapLink = C.RelmapLink . C.medLexmap
75
76-- | Reference base of nested relation references.
77--   This base is refered by 'relmapLocalNest'.
78relmapNest :: C.Intmed' h c -> O.Map (C.Relmap' h c)
79relmapNest = C.RelmapNest . C.medLexmap
80
81-- | Relation reference for nested relation.
82relmapLocalNest :: C.Intmed' h c -> S.TermName -> C.Relmap' h c
83relmapLocalNest med n = relmapLocal med $ S.LocalNest n
84
85-- | Reference base of copy-of-input relation reference.
86--   This base is refered by 'relmapLocalSymbol'.
87relmapCopy :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.RopName -> O.Map (C.Relmap' h c)
88relmapCopy = C.RelmapCopy . C.medLexmap
89
90-- | Relation reference for locally introduced relation.
91relmapLocalSymbol :: C.Intmed' h c -> C.RopName -> C.Relmap' h c
92relmapLocalSymbol med n = relmapLocal med $ S.LocalSymbol n
93
94relmapLocal :: C.Intmed' h c -> S.LocalRef -> C.Relmap' h c
95relmapLocal use ref = relmapLink use' where
96    lx    = C.medLexmap use
97    cp    = B.getCP lx
98    tok   = C.lexToken lx
99    use'  = use { C.medLexmap = lx' }
100    lx'   = lx  { C.lexType   = C.LexmapLocal
101                , C.lexToken  = S.TLocal cp ref (-1) [tok] }
102
103-- ----------------------
104-- $AppendRelmaps
105--
106--  This picture represents calculation
107--  of mapping input relation to output relation.
108--
109--  > input -[ relmap ]- output
110--
111--  Relmap /A/ maps relation /R1/ to relation /R2/.
112--  Another relmap /B/ maps /R2/ to /R3/.
113--
114--  > R1 -[ A ]- R2
115--  > R2 -[ B ]- R3
116--
117--  Two relmaps /A/ and /B/ are jointed
118--  with intermidiate relation /R2/.
119--
120--  > R1 -[ A ]- R2 -[ B ]- R3
121--
122--  Or, we can draw a directly jointed picture.
123--  This whole structure is also 'RelmapAppend' /A B/.
124--
125--  > R1 -[ A ]--[ B ]- R3
126
127
128-- ----------------------  Bundle of constructors
129
130-- | Second step of constructing relmap, make relmap from lexmap.
131type ConsRelmap' h c = C.Lexmap -> B.Ab (C.Relmap' h c)
132
133-- | Construct relmap from lexmap.
134consRelmap :: C.FindRop' h c -> h c -> ConsRelmap' h c
135consRelmap findRop hook = relmap where
136    relmap lx
137        | link      = Right $ C.RelmapLink lx
138        | otherwise = Msg.abRelmap [lx] $ case findRop name of
139                        Nothing  -> Msg.bug "missing operator"
140                        Just rop -> do sub <- namedRelmap `mapM` C.lexSubmap lx
141                                       C.ropCons rop $ C.Intmed hook lx sub
142        where link = C.lexType lx /= C.LexmapBase
143              name = C.lexName lx
144
145    namedRelmap (n, lx) = do rmap <- relmap lx
146                             Right (n, rmap)
147
